description: Import rejects bundles with unsupported formatVersion and returns a clear error.
Import rejects invalid JSON that fails the workflow-bundle v1 JSON Schema with a helpful message.
Import fails with structured missing-dependency errors when required actions/node types/schemas are absent.
Export a single workflow produces canonical JSON with stable formatting.
Export excludes instance-specific audit fields by default.
Import a bundle into an empty DB creates workflow_definitions and workflow_definition_versions records.
Import create-only policy fails when workflow key already exists (without force).
Import force overwrite deletes the existing workflow by key and recreates it with a regenerated workflow_id.
Import is transactional: if any DB write fails, no workflow_definitions or workflow_definition_versions are persisted.
Round-trip: create + publish a workflow, export it, import into a fresh DB, export again, and the canonical bundle matches (for supported fields).
Imported workflow can be executed end-to-end using Workflow Runtime V2 (triggered run reaches expected terminal state/output).
HTTP export endpoint returns a valid workflow bundle for an existing workflow.
HTTP import endpoint successfully imports a valid bundle and returns a summary.
CLI exports a workflow to a bundle file via the API.
CLI imports a bundle file via the API (including --force behavior).
